---
title: "About This Documentation"
---

![The Data Science Process @DoemerKempf2022_1000150238](pics/dsprocess.svg)


This is an example on how to incorporate executable Python code and show a figure output:

::: {.cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code code-fold="true"}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Generate sample data
x = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Create the plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 5))

ax.plot(x, y, color='blue', linewidth=2)

ax.set_xlabel('x')
ax.set_ylabel('y')
ax.set_title('Plot title')

ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)

plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![A simple demonstration of executable Python code producing a figure object.](index_files/figure-pdf/fig-demo-output-1.pdf){#fig-demo fig-pos='H'}
:::
:::


Then the figure can be referenced with @fig-demo.
